Package project.restaurant.controllers

Class OrderingController

java.lang.Object
project.restaurant.controllers.OrderingController
@Controller public class OrderingController extends Object
This class is a controller class to realize the action related to customer ordering item.
Author:
Pengyuan Tanmeet Wen Bailey Dan Irmani

  • Method Details

    • addOrderItem

      @PostMapping("/orderitem2") public String addOrderItem(@RequestParam("aMenuItem") Integer amenuitem, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      React to add button by adding an item into the basket.
      Parameters:
      amenuitem - the Menuitem id of the item that customer want
      model - is the Model type parameter help the back-end code to add attributes for front-end web page
      Returns:
      "orderingmenu" The webpage for customer order dishes

    • placeOrder2

      @PostMapping("/placeorder2") public String placeOrder2(org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestParam("tablenumber") Integer tablenumber)
      React to placeorder button by adding all item in the basket to database.
      Parameters:
      model - is the Model type parameter help the back-end code to add attributes for front-end web page
      session - A method to identify a user, a kitchenstaff or a waiter across more than one page
      tablenumber - is the number of table of customer
      Returns:
      "place-order-sucess" The webpage for a successful added item, otherwise redirect to "place-order-fail" which will show the user their added item has failed

    • getItem2

      @GetMapping("/basket") public String getItem2(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function will help the web page to generate the list of ordered item.
      Parameters:
      model - is the Model type parameter help the back-end code to add attribute for front-end web page
      Returns:
      "basket" The web page show customer what dishes are in the basket

    • getpayment

      @GetMapping("/Payment") public String getpayment(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method will retrieve payment information from a user.
      Parameters:
      model - Models help the back-end code to add attributes for front-end web page
      Returns:
      "cardpayment" The webpage for a user to put their payment information

    • addRowItem

      @GetMapping("/addRowItem") public String addRowItem(@Param("input") Integer input, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function react to the add button of the item list. It will increase one when the button have been clicked.
      Parameters:
      input - is the menuitem id of the item that customer want to have more.
      model - is the Model type parameter help the back-end code to add attribute for front-end web page
      Returns:
      "basket" The web page show customer what dishes are in the basket

    • deleteRowItem

      @GetMapping("/deleteRowItem") public String deleteRowItem(@Param("input") Integer input, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This method will remove an item in the basket.
      Parameters:
      input - The quantity of the item the user wants to purchase
      model - is the Model type parameter help the back-end code to add attribute for front-end web page
      Returns:
      "basket" The webpage to view what is currently in your basket

    • confirmOrder

      @GetMapping("/confirmOrders") public String confirmOrder(org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      This method will confirm an order and adds it to the menu_items database.
      Parameters:
      model - Models help the back-end code to add attributes for front-end web page
      session - A method to identify a user, a kitchenstaff or a waiter across more than one page
      Returns:
      "confirmOrder" The webpage that confirms to a user that their order has been placed

    • submitCard

      @PostMapping("/submitCard") public String submitCard(org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestParam("tablenumber") Integer tablenumber)
      This method will allow a user to securely send their card information to the payment team.
      Parameters:
      model - Models help the back-end code to add attributes for front-end web page
      session - A method to identify a user, a kitchenstaff or a waiter across more than one page
      tablenumber - The customers table number
      Returns:
      "place-order-sucess" The webpage confirming to an order their payment has been accepted
